oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Battle of Talladega"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white engraving depicts a battlefield scene. The image is surrounded by a filigree border with eagle and flag at the top and bayonette, flag, and cannon at the bottom. The artist is W. Groom.
The Battle of Talladega was a battle fought between the Tennessee volunteer militia and the Red Stick Creek Indians during the Creek War on November 9, 1813.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Creek War, 1813-1814;Indians of North America--Wars--1812-1815;Fort Mims (Ala.)
Campaigns & battles
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Baker, Samuel F.
